content:
• Friday, September 13, 2019
  • KDMN

    Kadmon -2.5% after mixed shelf, shareholder registration

    • Kadmon Holdings (NYSE:KDMN) is 2.5% lower after hours following a $200M mixed shelf registration and a secondary filing for holders to offer up to 7.34M shares.
    • Of the secondary, 4.88M shares are registered common stock, and 2.46M shares of common stock would be issued upon conversion of 5% convertible preferred stock.
    • The company won't receive any proceeds from any sales by the selling stockholders.
    • Those selling stockholders include major holders Perceptive Life Sciences Master Fund and Third Point Loan LLC, as well as GoldenTree 2004 Trust.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 3 Comments

  • EGO, OAS and AOBC among notable after hours movers

    • Top Gainers: CYTK +4.9%. AOBC +2.4%. EGO +1.9%. BRFS +1.2%.
    • Top Losers: AUPH -2.9%. OAS -2.4%. CNHI -1.8%. FRAN -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • AIMT

    FDA advisory committee backs Aimmune's AR101 for peanut allergy

    • The FDA's Allergenic Products Advisory Committee voted 7 - 2 backing the efficacy of Aimmune Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:AIMT) Palforzia (AR101) to reduce the incidence and severity of allergic reactions to peanut in young people aged 4 - 17 who have a confirmed diagnosis of peanut allergy.
    • Update: The committee is discussing a REMS strategy ahead of the safety vote. The agency will require documentation that any patient prescribed Palforzia also has a valid prescription for injectable epinephrine that caregivers and patients must confirm that they are carrying while taking Palforzia and initial dose escalation and the first dose of each up-dosing level must be administered in a certified facility capable of handling systemic allergic reactions. Labeling will include a black box warning.
    • Update: The committee voted 8 - 1 backing safety.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 86 Comments

  • Cloudflare closes first day up 20%

    • Cloudflare (NYSE:NET) closes its first day of trading up 20% to $18.
    • Rival Fastly (NYSE:FSLY) closed down 3.7% to $29.04.
    • Related: Cloudflare started the day at $18 after pricing at $15 and shares traded as high as $19.53 during the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • FCX

    Freeport McMoRan surges alongside copper prices

    • Freeport McMoRan (FCX +3.9%) ranks among today's top three gainers on the S&P 500 as copper prices rise, capping a 30%-plus surge since hitting a 52-week low $8.58 on Aug. 27.
    • Front-month Comex copper futures hit their highest in a month and a half, +2.2% to $2.699/lb., as investors hoped an easing of U.S.-China trade tensions eventually could lift metals demand.
    • FCX has enjoyed an increasing amount of bullish options activity in recent days, Mott Capital Management observes.
    • Top global miners Rio Tinto (RIO +2.2%) and (BHP +1.9%) also sport strong gains in today's trade.
    • ETFs: JJCTF, COPX, CPER
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM | 30 Comments

  • Investors re-think rate cut odds

    • We can probably begin thinking about using the word "crash" to describe the action in the bond market over the past two weeks. The 10-year Treasury yield is up another 12.5 basis points today to 1.90% - that's a 45 basis point move since Labor Day.
    • Checking the short end, traders are quickly bailing out of long positions in short-dated Eurodollar and Fed Funds futures. A 25-basis point rate cut this month was a near-metaphysical certainty just days ago (and a 50-basis point cut was under serious debate), but the betting now says there's more than a 20% chance of no move at all.
    • The Fed's meeting begins next Tuesday, with the decision to be announced Wednesday afternoon. Should be fun.
    • Broad U.S. fixed-income ETFs: PTY, AGG, BND, BOND, RCS, SCHZ, BTZ, PCM, DBL, FBND, IUSB, BHK, SPAB, JHI, AGGY, HIPS, PAI
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM | 95 Comments
  • CRK

    'Bank of Jerry Jones' provides unique advantage to surging Comstock

    • Comstock Resources (CRK +10.8%) cranks out another 52-week high, capping an 80%-plus run-up since Aug. 27, as investors take a liking to the Texas oil driller that boasts an asset that rivals don't: Jerry Jones' bank account.
    • CRK management recently said Jones is not "afraid to inject another $1.1B into the company when the opportunity presents itself," which would match the amount Jones already has contributed to the company over the past 18 months, according to Seaport Global analyst Mike Kelly, who says Jones' continued presence is a major positive for the driller at a time when many oil and gas firms find it difficult to access the capital markets.
    • Jones defended his bullish take on shale gas earlier this month, despite the 14% slide in U.S. nat gas prices this year amid a supply glut.
    • Seaport reiterates a Buy rating on CRK and hikes its price target to $11 from $8, saying the driller has "a long runway of some of the highest rate of return inventory in the space... and near unrestricted access to the Bank of Jerry Jones."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • ITVPY

    ITV up as Liberum suggests divesting SDN, buying STV

    • UK broadcaster ITV (ITVPY +4.1%) is on the rise today following a note from Liberum suggesting the company could raise £750M-£1B from divesting its SDN business.
    • The company already announced the sale of its South Bank site.
    • Now cash from an SDN investment could go to debt reduction or strategic acquisition, and Liberum points to buying STV as an option there. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • The rest could go to shareholders, and (for example) a £500M buyback would be 4% accretive in fiscal 2019, the firm says.
    • Shares rose 5.1% to close out the week in London.
    • Yesterday, the company launched a tender for up to €500M in debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM

  • AAPL

    Apple denies Goldman's TV+ claims

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) disputes the Goldman Sachs note that says the one-year free trial for Apple TV+ with some device purchases would have a "material negative impact" on earnings.
    • Apple's statement to CNBC: "We do not expect the introduction of Apple TV+, including the accounting treatment for the service, to have a material impact on our financial results."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 144 Comments

  • Roan Resources and Key Energy Services among Energy/Materials gainers; Alexco Resource and Independence Contract Drilling among losers

    • Gainers: Roan Resources (NYSE:ROAN) +11%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +11%. Comstock Resources (NYSE:CRK) +10%. Ferroglobe (NASDAQ:GSM) +8%. Cimarex Energy (NYSE:XEC) +7%.

  • CURLF

    Curaleaf wins approval for adult-use licenses in Massachusetts; shares gain

    • The company says the Massachusetts Cannabis Control Commission has approved thee final and two provisional adult-use licenses.
    • The three final adult-use licenses are: A retail license to be co-located with the current medical retail location in Oxford, and two licenses for cultivation and manufacturing.
    • The provisional licenses include a new retail location in Provincetown - which would be the first location on upper Cape Cod.
    • OTCPK:CURLF +2.5%
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM | 10 Comments
  • AAPL

    Apple bear sees weak iPhone 11 demand

    • Rosenblatt says Apple (AAPL -2.3%) is seeing "weak" pre-orders for the iPhone 11 family, citing conversations with retailers.
    • Analyst Jun Zhang says "there is no wait time today for the iPhone 11 Pro and Max" in the United States, suggesting that initial sales could be 20-30% lower than last year's iPhone XS and Max sales.
    • Demand in China might also be low as companies focus on 5G models, says Zhang. On JD.com, iPhone 11 pre-orders are about 500K compared to 900K for the iPhone XR last year.
    • Rosenblatt maintains a Sell rating on Apple and a Street-low $150 target. Apple has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM | 109 Comments

  • Dragon Victory International leads financial gainers, MDJM and Puyi among losers

  • CARS

    Cars.com spikes following OEM news with General Motors

    • Cars.com (CARS +10.7%) says it has been selected as a website provider for General Motors' (GM +0.3%) 4K-plus U.S.-based Chevrolet, Buick, GMC and Cadillac dealerships.
    • "We first became a GM managed digital advertising vendor in October 2018, and our team is excited to now expand our offerings and deepen our relationships with GM dealerships," says Joe Chura, CEO and co-founder of Cars.com's Dealer Inspire unit.
    • Dealer Inspire achieved an average dealer satisfaction score of 9.5 out of 10 in 2019, the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 8 Comments

  • Cloudflare +27% after NYSE debut

    • Cloudflare (NYSE:NET) starts its first day of trading at $18 after pricing at $15 per share, above the original $12-$14 range.
    • The Fastly (FSLY -5.2%) competitor raised $525M in the IPO.
    • NET shares are currently up 27% to $19.03.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 15 Comments
  • EFOI

    Energy Focus down 14% post Q2 revenue miss

    • Energy Focus (EFOI -14.4%) reported Q2 sales declined of 40.4% Y/Y to $3.08M, driven by a 56.8% decrease in military sales period over period.
    • Q2 Gross loss was $109k, compare to gross profit of $1.29M a year ago.
    • Loss from operations expanded to $2.15M, compared to $1.8M a year ago.
    • Adj. EBITDA loss was $2M up from $1.45M last year same quarter.
    • Net cash used in operating activities was $1.56M. Cash and cash equivalents were $2.2M as of June 30, 2019.
    • Towards the end of the quarter, company announced a $3M contract extension with a major healthcare provider that has been customer since 2015 with over 440,000 installed Energy Focus LED lamps in their campuses.
    • Previously: Energy Focus EPS in-line, misses on revenue (Sept. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • FNMA

    New federal rules to cap Fannie, Freddie lending for multifamily properties

    • The regulator of Fannie Mae (OTCQB:FNMA +2.9%) and Freddie Mac (OTCQB:FMCC +3.3%) moves to cap the amount of multifamily home loans the companies can buy each year, in one of the Trump administration's first moves to revamp the companies' businesses.
    • The Federal Housing Finance Agency says it plans to limit purchases to $100B each and plans to eliminate exemptions from such caps for "green" loans - lending for energy and water efficiency improvements at multifamily properties such as smart thermostats or low-flow toilets.
    • The changes would mark a reversal from Obama-era policies which imposed no limits on the amount of green multifamily loans the companies could buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 15 Comments
  • PFE

    FDA warns on rare side effect of breast cancer meds

    • The FDA has issued a warning concerning the incidence of rare severe lung inflammation in some patients receiving Pfizer's (PFE -0.8%) Ibrance (palbociclib), Novartis' (NVS -2%) Kisqali (ribociclib) or Eli Lilly's (LLY -0.3%) Verzenio (abemaciclib), all cyclin-dependent kinase 4/6 inhibitors.
    • Labeling has been updated about the risk. The agency recommends that patients talk to their doctors before considering stopping treatment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 4 Comments
  • INGN

    Inogen up 6% on bullish Piper comments

    • Inogen (INGN +5.9%) is up on almost a 50% surge in volume, albeit down 10% from its intraday high of $55.41, in apparent response to a note from Piper Jaffray's J.P. McKim (Overweight/$80) expressing confidence in its ability to deliver double-digit growth in 2020 after meeting with management.
    • Shares sold off 23% on August 7 after the company cut its 2019 revenue outlook by 9% (midpoint of guidance range). Q2 revenues were up only 4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TEAM

    Atlassian +1.7% as bull praises price increase

    • William Blair’s Bhavan Suri says Atlassian (NASDAQ:TEAM) has increased pricing for its three larger products, which could prompt cloud customers to move to annual contracts for the discount.
    • The analyst says the shift could benefit billings for the next quarter or two, and notes that TEAM remains a price leader in the market.
    • William Blair maintains an Outperform rating. TEAM has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
    • TEAM shares are up 1.7% to $127.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment

  • Hungary permits three firms in 5G bidding

    • After expecting four or five companies to bid for 5G spectrum, Hungary has allowed three companies to take part.
    • Vodafone (VOD +0.9%), Telenor (TELNY +0.2%) and Magyar Telekom (MYTAY +8.3%) are in the bidding, Bloomberg reports.
    • Hungary's telecom regulator ruled out an unspecified fourth bidder. Results will come later in the fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM | 4 Comments

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: Fibrocell Science (NASDAQ:FCSC) +60%. OpGen (NASDAQ:OPGN) +24%. ASLAN Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ASLN) +20%. Autolus Therapeutics (NASDAQ:AUTL) +20%. Digirad (NASDAQ:DRAD) +18%.
    • Losers: Ritter Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RTTR) -71%. Ardelyx (NASDAQ:ARDX) -11%. VistaGen Therapeutics (NASDAQ:VTGN) -10%. Sintx Technologies (NASDAQ:SINT) -7%. PDL BioPharma (NASDAQ:PDLI) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • LL

    Lumber Liquidators too expensive, says founder

    • Speaking to Bloomberg, Lumber Liquidators (NYSE:LL) founder Tom Sullivan says he's not interested in buying the company as the stock price has gotten too high. In fact, he says, he's planning on unloading some of his shares.
    • LL is down 8.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 31 Comments
  • RFIL

    RF Industries slips 9% post Q3 results

    • RF Industries (RFIL -9.2%) reported Q3 sales growth of 31.2% Y/Y to $15.5M, reflecting a full quarter of sales contribution from C Enterprises, and growth in both t traditional run rate business and project work in the OEM and wireless carrier markets.
    • Q3 Gross margin declined by 663 bps to 27.5%, primarily due to product mix at the Custom Cabling segment and wages for production team; and operating margin declined by 882 bps to 8.2%.
    • S&G expenses were $2.61M (+49% Y/Y); and as percentage of sales 16.8% up by 200 bps.
    • Backlog was $8M at July 31, 2019 on Q3 bookings of $13.4M.
    • Company reported cash and cash equivalents of $13.3M, a current ratio of 6-to-1 and no outstanding debt.
    • Company says they will continue to execute on long-term growth plan and expect to achieve year-over-year sales growth in both Q4 and FY19, as they work toward plan of reaching $100M in sales over the next few years.
    • Previously: RF Industries reports Q3 results (Sept. 12)
    • Previously: RF Industries declares $0.02 dividend (Sept. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • DRAD

    Digirad up 24%

    • Ultra-thinly traded nano cap Digirad (DRAD +24.3%) is up on a whopping 111x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of 988K shares, in early trade.
    • This morning, it announced that its newly issued 10.0% Series A Cumulative Perpetual Preferred Stock with a stated value of $10 per share is now trading on The Nasdaq Global Market under the symbol "DRADP."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM | 4 Comments
  • ANSS

    ANSYS +2% on target boost

    • Griffin Securities upgrades ANSYS (NASDAQ:ANSS) from Neutral to Buy with a $240 target, a 14% upside.
    • The investment banking firm expects ANSYS to remain the market leader by revenue in simulation software.
    • ANSYS shares are up 2% to $215.39. The company has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • SNY

    FDA alerts on Zantac contamination

    • The FDA is alerting the public that certain ranitidine medicines, including Zantac, contain low levels of a carcinogen called NDMA. The agency is investigating the matter, adding that it is not advising consumers to stop taking the drugs at this time.
    • Related tickers: Sanofi (SNY -0.3%), ANI Pharmaceuticals (ANIP +0.5%), Endo International (ENDP -1.5%), Dr. Reddy's Laboratories (RDY -0.9%); Amneal Pharmaceuticals (AMRX -0.6%), Mylan (MYL), Teligent (TLGT +1.9%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 14 Comments

  • Juul reported to be lower on secondary market

    • The valuation on Juul (JUUL) is down to around $225 to $230 per share in the secondary market following this week's vaping focus from the government, according to reporting by CNBC's David Faber.
    • Altria (MO -1.3%) stepped in to take its 35% stake in Juul at a level of about $250 per share on the secondary market.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 113 Comments
  • EARS

    Auris clarifies endpoint for Phase 2/3 study of Keyzilen for tinnitus; shares up 3%

    • Auris Medical Holding (EARS +3.4%) announces that the FDA and EMA are both on board with the use of the Tinnitus Functional Index (TFI) as the primary efficacy endpoint for its planned Phase 2/3 clinical trial evaluating Keyzilen (AM-101) in patients with the chronic ear-ringing condition.
    • The two regulators also agreed on less frequent collection of patient-reported tinnitus loudness compared to previous trials where daily ratings were difficult to gather. The FDA considers the improvement in tinnitus loudness as a co-primary endpoint while the EMA considers it a secondary endpoint.
    • The company says it plans to support the continued development of Keyzilen with non-dilutive funding. Options include strategic partnering, special purpose vehicle financing, grant funding or a combination thereof.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • LUV

    Macquarie sees upside on Southwest Airlines

    • Macquarie says it's adding Southwest Airlines (NYSE:LUV) to its list of Outperform-rated airline stocks that includes United Airlines, Delta Air Lines and Allegiant Travel.
    • "We think that the airline will now be able to fully utilize its new revenue management system and more efficiently schedule its aircraft as the MAX's are ungrounded and reintroduced into their system," updates analyst Susan Donofrio.
    • "We also like Southwest’s move to join Travelport and Amadeus Travel Platforms global distribution systems as we think that it gives the airline a new growth platform with small to medium businesses," she adds.
    • Macquarie lifts its price target on LUV to $67 off a 14.0X earnings multiple vs. old price target of $52 and 12.0X multiple. The sell-side consensus PT on Southwest is down to $58.21.
    • Shares of LUV are up 1.29% premarket to $55.60.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment

  • SDRL, MNK among premarket gainers

    • Mer Telemanagement Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSL) +96% on 1H results.
    • Fibrocell Science, Inc. (NASDAQ:FCSC) +60% on Castle Creek bid.
    • Cellectar Biosciences, Inc. (NASDAQ:CLRB) +14%.
    • Mallinckrodt plc (NYSE:MNK) +14% on cost-effectiveness of Acthar Gel for late-line MS relapses.
    • Bitauto Holdings(NYSE:BITA) +12% on Tencent go-private offer.
    • Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) +10% on discontinuing stock offering.
    • PG&E (NYSE:PCG) +9% on $11B settlement on California wildfire claims.
    • Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) +7%.
    • Ideanomics (NASDAQ:IDEX) +6% on strategic partnership with the China National Petroleum.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM | 2 Comments
  • VNCE

    Vince Holdings +19% after above-consensus guidance

    • Vince Holdings (NYSE:VNCE) pops after setting favorable guidance amid the tough tariff scenario.
    • The company expects full-year revenue of $295M to $305M vs. $290M to $300M prior view and $297M consensus.
    • Vince delved into the tariff issue on the post-earnings conference call (transcript). "We have been implementing mitigation efforts, including accelerating shipments which we started in the second quarter and continue negotiations with our vendors, who have been good partners in working with us on pricing," stated CEO Brendan Hoffman.
    • Shares of Vince are up 18.80% premarket to $13.65.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • TLT

    Treasurys give up more ground after strong retail sales print

    • August retail sales topped expectations, rising 0.4% vs. 0.2% expected. July's print was upwardly revised to a 0.8% gain.
    • "Control group" sales gained 0.3%, matching expectations, but again, July's advance was revised higher.
    • Continuing an ugly month, bonds sold off hard on the news, with the 10-year Treasury yield jumping another six basis points to 1.836%. TLT -1.05%, TBT +2.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 42 Comments

  • MCF, RTTR among premarket losers

    • Ritter Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RTTR) -72% after RP-G28 flunks late-stage study.
    • Contango Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:MCF) -20% on pricing equity offering.
    • Ardelyx (NASDAQ:ARDX) -12% after FDA's decision on tenapanor for IBS-C.
    • Sintx Technologies (NASDAQ:SINT) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • PCG

    PG&E reaches $11B settlement on California wildfire claims

    • PG&E (NYSE:PCG) +8.4% pre-market after announcing an $11B agreement in principle with groups representing ~85% of insurance subrogation claims related to the 2017 northern California wildfires and the 2018 Camp Fire.
    • PG&E reaffirms the total $14B equity financing commitment target for its reorganization plan, and says it has received $1.5B in renewed commitments and intends to seek remaining equity financing commitments over the next several weeks.
    • The settlement is subject to approval of the Bankruptcy Court overseeing PG&E's Chapter 11 case, and follows a $1B settlement reached in June with 18 local public entities.

  • Dow and S&P closing in on records

    • The Dow this session is looking to surpass an intraday record high of 27,398.68, while the S&P 500 is closing in on its previous record of 3,027.98, as the rally continues with stock index futures ahead by 0.2%.
